intro: Derris macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited senna, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the Fabaceae family. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. The fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are used in traditional medicine.
